title: Bootstrap with JavaScript
subject: Bootstrap
theory:
## Controlling Behavior
Every component has a JavaScript API.

### Methods
`show()`, `hide()`, `toggle()`, `dispose()`.

### Events
Bootstrap fires events you can listen to.
* `show.bs.modal`: Fires immediately when show is called.
* `shown.bs.modal`: Fires when animation finishes and modal is visible.
* `hidden.bs.modal`: Fires when modal is closed.

common_mistakes.correction: Bootstrap 5 is Vanilla JS. `$('#myModal').modal('show')` does not work unless you manually installed jQuery adapter.

summary: The JS API allows tight integration with application logic.
